title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Command and Control Capability

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to improve Bulgarian forces interoperable command and control capabilities within its force protection companies for operations outside the wire in support of the ISAF mission. Recipient units will be the 2nd Infantry Brigade, the 61st Mechanized Brigade, and the Special Task Unit. Equipment provided includes radios, network communications equipment, and battlefield situational awareness equipment.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Counterterrorism Capability Training and Development

description.narrative: Section 2282 Building Capacity of Foreign Security Forces programs (formerly known as Section 1206 Train and Equip), are intended to build partnership capacity for time-sensitive "new and emerging" counter-terrorist operations or to participate in or support military and stability operations in which the U.S. Armed Forces are a participant.

title.narrative: Inter-European Air Forces Academy Mobile Training Team - Sofia

description.narrative: This is a two-week course which provides an abbreviated version of the IESOS and IENCOA curriculum. It prepares NCOs and junior officers for more advanced leadership and management responsibilities. Students learn time and stress management, concepts of human behavior, teambuilding, critical thinking, effective communication, and leadership techniques, as well as implementing quality in the workplace. Experiential course activities challenge each student to apply curriculum concepts successfully and to influence group dynamics, cohesion, and effectiveness in a positive manner. By virtue of their international student body, IEAFA courses foster positive relationships between NATO and Partnership for Peace (PfP) members, as well as expanding students cultural knowledge and learning in a manner consistent with U.S. and NATO objectives.

title.narrative: Inter-European Aviation Safety Program Management Mobile Course - Bulgaria

description.narrative: This two-week mobile version of the in-residence course was conducted in Sofia, Bulgaria. It is designed to provide students assigned to Flight Safety Officer (FSO) positions with a working knowledge of aviation mishap prevention. The course graduate is capable of administrating an aircraft mishap prevention program to include: Bird/wildlife aircraft strike hazard (BASH), midair collision avoidance (MACA), hazardous air traffic reports (HATRs), hazard reporting, inspections, airfield safety, Air Force Safety Automated System (AFSAS) queries, awards, disaster response, deployed safety, as well as philosophies and an understanding of the safety organizational hierarchy/philosophies. The course places Risk Management at the center of establishing a safety culture and addresses concepts, methodologies and best practices in the area of Risk Management, while providing how-to instruction in applying primary and select RM tools and techniques. IEASPM brings together aviation safety professionals from across NATO and PfP, standardizing tactics, techniques and procedures across the Alliance while building a common cadre of aviation safety professionals.
